description: Erection of part two storey, part single storey rear extension to No 146 and single storey rear extensions to Nos. 142  and 144 together with six car parking spaces, cycle store and landscaping of whole site
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted ( Design and access statement, 1885/10, 1885/11, 1885/5, Schedule of external materials and landscaping. Received: 28th February 2019 ) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extensions hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - Before first occupation of the development hereby approved, full details (including manufacturers' specifications) of secure, covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 8 (eight) cycle) for the occupant of the development have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the West London Cycle Parking Guidance in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 5 - A splay of 2.4m x 2.4m shall be provided on each side of the access, the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, and no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected within the areas of such splays.

Condition : 6 - Full details of the proposed parking and turning arrangements shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development. The space approved shall be kept available for parking and turning in association with the development.

Condition : 7 - No part of the development shall be occupied until full details of electric vehicle parking provision (7.2kW output) has been provided in accordance with details that have first been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform with requirements stipulated within the London Plan and be made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 8 - The windows formed in the north elevation of the single storey rear extension to 142 shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.
